<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOGRAPHY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/06/coronavirus-impacting-us-states?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
50 States of COVID-19
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="50 states of COVID" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDQvNTBfc3RhdGVzX29mX2NvdmlkLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With over 330,000 confirmed cases, the U.S. has the largest COVID-19 outbreak in the world. But that's the Alexander Hamilton POV; let’s channel our inner Thomas Jefferson and examine the pandemic’s effect on <a href="https://www.citylab.com/equity/2020/04/coronavirus-spread-map-city-urban-density-suburbs-rural-data/609394/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">state economies</a>.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">From the top</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Maine was rated the <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-states/florida-nevada-may-be-hit-hardest-by-coronavirus-economic-shock-study-idUSKBN21O1SK?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most vulnerable state</a> to economic shock from the pandemic by Oxford Economics. It has a high proportion of elderly residents and a larger-than-average workforce that's self-employed or employed by small businesses.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Maine's famous seafood industry is <a href="https://apnews.com/308352a4521171c83284a850bb892277?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">already facing</a> a painful dropoff in demand. Wholesale lobster prices were down 33% in March compared to 2018. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The South </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As of last week, one in 10 COVID-19 deaths took place in Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, or Georgia, per the COVID Tracking Project. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New Orleans's death rate is double NYC's. Louisiana's governor said its population is <a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2020/04/coronavirus-unique-threat-south-young-people/609241/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more at risk</a> to COVID-19 due to high levels of underlying conditions like hypertension, obesity, and lung and kidney disease.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And the southern-but-not-South? </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With the second-highest proportion of seniors, Florida is also one of the most at-risk states. IHS Markit economist Karl Kuykendall said it could lose 8% of its jobs by the end of the year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then there's Texas, which is also <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/texas-gets-double-punch-from-coronavirus-and-oil-shock-theres-no-avoiding-this-one-11586113727?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">getting whacked</a> by an oil price collapse. About half the 70 U.S. oil companies at risk of bankruptcy are headquartered there, and even if prices rebound, demand may not. State unemployment could be 0.5%–1% worse than the national average, a Dallas Fed official told the WSJ. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The swing states </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While you prematurely fill out a 2020 scorecard, keep a close eye on...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Pennsylvania, where unemployment claims </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/f5258035e36ba0e4349763f1b44f77ee?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">passed 1 million</a></span><span> in the last three weeks.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Michigan, where Detroit's high poverty rate is </span><span><a href="https://www.metrotimes.com/news-hits/archives/2020/03/30/dr-fauci-says-hes-worried-about-coronavirus-spread-in-detroit?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expected</a></span><span> to fuel an especially deadly outbreak.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Ohio, where municipal governments are </span><span><a href="https://www.dispatch.com/news/20200406/coronavirus-relying-on-income-tax-makes-ohio-cities-vulnerable-to-economic-slowdown?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disproportionally funded</a></span><span> through income taxes. That's especially bad news when unemployment is rising, business activity is slowing, and tax filing is delayed.</span>
</li>
</ul>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/06/jamie-dimons-annual-shareholder-letter-focuses-covid19-impacts?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Pandemic According to Jamie Dimon
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="JPMorgan" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDYvamFtaWVfZGltb24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>"<a href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/jurvetson/8362210873/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Jamie Dimon, CEO of JPMorgan Chase</a>" (<a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY 2.0</a>) by <a href="https://www.flickr.com/people/jurvetson/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jurvetson</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Jamie Dimon's been here before. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, kinda. He's the only current CEO of a major bank to have led his company through the 2008 financial crisis. Yesterday, the de facto spokesman for American finance used his <a href="https://reports.jpmorganchase.com/investor-relations/2019/ar-ceo-letters.htm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">annual JPMorgan shareholder letter</a> to dish on coronavirus's impact on the economy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How bad is it going to be? </strong>"At a minimum, we assume that it will include a bad recession combined with some kind of financial stress similar to the global financial crisis of 2008."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Surely you're not considering suspending your dividend? </strong><em>Potentially</em>, if things get so bad that GDP falls as much as 35% in Q2 and stays there through the end of the year and unemployment hits 14% in Q4. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How about small biz help? </strong>In the past 60 days, JPMorgan extended $950 million in new loans.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Final piece of wisdom: </strong>"Entering into a crisis is not the time to figure out what you want to be. You must already be a well-functioning organization prepared to rapidly mobilize your resources, take your losses, and survive another day for the good of all your stakeholders."  </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Dimon%27s+the+only+current+CEO+of+a+major+bank+to+have+led+his+company+through+the+2008+financial+crisis&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/06/jamie-dimons-annual-shareholder-letter-focuses-covid19-impacts&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

</a><span>  </span>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

</th>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOSPITALITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/06/airbnb-finds-1b-infusion?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Airbnb’s Rare Find
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Airbnb <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/06/airbnb-raising-1-billion-amid-fallout-from-coronanvirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> a $1 billion infusion from private equity firms Silver Lake and Sixth Street Partners. Last time Airbnb raised money in 2017, it was valued at $31 billion, but it recently revised that down to $26 billion because of, well, you know.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In some U.S. urban markets, coronavirus knocked reservations by </span><span><a href="https://www.citylab.com/life/2020/04/coronavirus-safe-travel-airbnb-rental-business-host-bailout/608917/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">50% or more</a></span><span> in mid-March, according to data from AirDNA.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In response, Airbnb <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/30/airbnb-extends-coronavirus-cancellation-window-to-may-31-due-to-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">loosened</a> its cancelation policy, set aside $250 million to pay hosts 25% of lost revenues, and reportedly <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-airbnb-workforce/airbnb-to-halt-all-marketing-most-hiring-as-losses-mount-the-information-idUSKBN21E3J5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">canceled</a> 2020 marketing to save $800 million. Still, thousands of hosts and an ecosystem of property managers, cleaners, and other service providers are dealing with dwindling or nonexistent income.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What comes next</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Airbnb’s latest round doesn’t come with a target IPO date. The company wanted to go public this year but a global pandemic wasn’t exactly in the 5-year plan. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Real estate experts told City Lab that some hosts might pivot to longer-term rentals to bring in money. Others think the pendulum might swing back to traditional hotels in the medium-term, where cleaning standards are a little more...consistent. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F04%2F06%2Fairbnb-finds-1b-infusion" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>
</td>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY BETTERMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Why Don’t We Talk About Money?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Of all the things we discuss on a daily basis with anyone from our mom to our mom’s friend Carol, why do we get so nervous talking money? We all have it, we all want more of it, and we all have questions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So we’re gonna talk about money, and it’s going to be ok. We’ve <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/08/youve-got-moneynow" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">put together an article with the help of our friends at Betterment</a> that discusses everything from hidden fees to automation to, well, how to talk about money.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/08/youve-got-moneynow" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the article</a> could be about 3 billion pages long, we’ve distilled it down to the topics we think can help you the most at this point in your life—when you’re on that upward career trajectory that is both exhilarating and terrifying.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So even if you’re not quite ready to talk about money, we recommend you at least start <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/08/youve-got-moneynow" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reading</a> about it. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And we know we’re biased, but we <em>really </em>recommend <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/08/youve-got-moneynow" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">you start here</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if !mso]><! -- -->
</div>
<!-- <![endif]-->


<!--[if !mso ]><! -- -->
<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GIG ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/06/uber-directs-idle-drivers-job-opportunities?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Uber the Recruiter
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Uber released a new feature that will help U.S. drivers find work both in its other divisions and at companies not at all affiliated with Uber.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The program, called the </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-uber/uber-connects-out-of-work-us-ride-hail-drivers-to-delivery-production-jobs-idUSKBN21O1LV?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Work Hub</a></span><span>, will connect workers to about 15 companies nationwide that are hiring in volume, including Domino's, Amazon, and Walgreens. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It'll also link drivers to internal opportunities with Uber Eats, Uber Freight, and Uber Works, the temporary staffing program it launched in 2019.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Demand for ride-hailing has fallen off a COVID cliff. With Uber's lobbying help, the $2.2 trillion economic relief package grants <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/30/cares-act-will-be-an-economic-lifeline-for-gig-workers-freelancers.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unprecedented</a> financial assistance to gig workers; however, some Uber drivers have reported difficulty <a href="https://onezero.medium.com/drivers-say-the-uber-coronavirus-fund-is-failing-them-8c36aceace78?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">getting help</a> from the company. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The Work Hub shows Uber has managed to meaningfully diversify its business beyond hauling human passengers. And it syncs with the company's long-term goal of aggregating a fleet of temp workers who can move from industry to industry. </p>

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On World Health Day, all healthcare professionals and volunteers deserve a shoutout for their hard work and bravery. But today, we're tipping our hat to a small segment of the medical workforce that has an outsized impact during times of need: <strong style="color:#000">travel nurses</strong>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thank you times 1 million for <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/06/travel-nurses-race-to-new-york-and-other-coronavirus-hot-spots-they-are-literally-in-a-war-zone.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">heading to the states</a> hardest hit by COVID-19, like our homebase New York, and filling in where help is needed most.</p>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith over 330,000 confirmed cases, the U.S. has the largest COVID-19 outbreak in the world. But that's the Alexander Hamilton POV; let’s channel our inner Thomas Jefferson and examine the pandemic’s effect on \u003ca href=\"https://www.citylab.com/equity/2020/04/coronavirus-spread-map-city-urban-density-suburbs-rural-data/609394/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estate economies\u003c/a\u003e.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFrom the top\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMaine was rated the \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-states/florida-nevada-may-be-hit-hardest-by-coronavirus-economic-shock-study-idUSKBN21O1SK?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost vulnerable state\u003c/a\u003e to economic shock from the pandemic by Oxford Economics. It has a high proportion of elderly residents and a larger-than-average workforce that's self-employed or employed by small businesses.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMaine's famous seafood industry is \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/308352a4521171c83284a850bb892277?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealready facing\u003c/a\u003e a painful dropoff in demand. Wholesale lobster prices were down 33% in March compared to 2018. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe South \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs of last week, one in 10 COVID-19 deaths took place in Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, or Georgia, per the COVID Tracking Project. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNew Orleans's death rate is double NYC's. Louisiana's governor said its population is \u003ca href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2020/04/coronavirus-unique-threat-south-young-people/609241/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore at risk\u003c/a\u003e to COVID-19 due to high levels of underlying conditions like hypertension, obesity, and lung and kidney disease.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnd the southern-but-not-South? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith the second-highest proportion of seniors, Florida is also one of the most at-risk states. IHS Markit economist Karl Kuykendall said it could lose 8% of its jobs by the end of the year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThen there's Texas, which is also \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/texas-gets-double-punch-from-coronavirus-and-oil-shock-theres-no-avoiding-this-one-11586113727?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egetting whacked\u003c/a\u003e by an oil price collapse. About half the 70 U.S. oil companies at risk of bankruptcy are headquartered there, and even if prices rebound, demand may not. State unemployment could be 0.5%–1% worse than the national average, a Dallas Fed official told the WSJ. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe swing states \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile you prematurely fill out a 2020 scorecard, keep a close eye on...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePennsylvania, where unemployment claims \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/f5258035e36ba0e4349763f1b44f77ee?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epassed 1 million\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the last three weeks.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMichigan, where Detroit's high poverty rate is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.metrotimes.com/news-hits/archives/2020/03/30/dr-fauci-says-hes-worried-about-coronavirus-spread-in-detroit?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpected\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to fuel an especially deadly outbreak.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOhio, where municipal governments are \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.dispatch.com/news/20200406/coronavirus-relying-on-income-tax-makes-ohio-cities-vulnerable-to-economic-slowdown?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edisproportionally funded\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e through income taxes. href=\"https://www.flickr.com/photos/jurvetson/8362210873/\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eJamie Dimon, CEO of JPMorgan style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJamie Dimon's been here before. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWell, kinda. He's the only current CEO of a major bank to have led his company through the 2008 financial crisis. Yesterday, the de facto spokesman for American finance used his \u003ca href=\"https://reports.jpmorganchase.com/investor-relations/2019/ar-ceo-letters.htm?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannual JPMorgan shareholder letter\u003c/a\u003e to dish on coronavirus's impact on the economy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow bad is it going to be? \u003c/strong\u003e\"At a minimum, we assume that it will include a bad recession combined with some kind of financial stress similar to the global financial crisis of 2008.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSurely you're not considering suspending your dividend? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cem\u003ePotentially\u003c/em\u003e, if things get so bad that GDP falls as much as 35% in Q2 and stays there through the end of the year and unemployment hits 14% in Q4. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow about small biz help? \u003c/strong\u003eIn the past 60 days, JPMorgan extended $950 million in new loans.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFinal piece of wisdom: \u003c/strong\u003e\"Entering into a crisis is not the time to figure out what you want to be. You must already be a well-functioning organization prepared to rapidly mobilize your resources, take your losses, and survive another day for the good of all your Find\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Airbnb \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/06/airbnb-raising-1-billion-amid-fallout-from-coronanvirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e a $1 billion infusion from private equity firms Silver Lake and Sixth Street Partners. Last time Airbnb raised money in 2017, it was valued at $31 billion, but it recently revised that down to $26 billion because of, well, you know.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn some U.S. urban markets, coronavirus knocked reservations by \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.citylab.com/life/2020/04/coronavirus-safe-travel-airbnb-rental-business-host-bailout/608917/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e50% or more\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in mid-March, according to data from AirDNA.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn response, Airbnb \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/30/airbnb-extends-coronavirus-cancellation-window-to-may-31-due-to-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eloosened\u003c/a\u003e its cancelation policy, set aside $250 million to pay hosts 25% of lost revenues, and reportedly \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-airbnb-workforce/airbnb-to-halt-all-marketing-most-hiring-as-losses-mount-the-information-idUSKBN21E3J5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecanceled\u003c/a\u003e 2020 marketing to save $800 million. Still, thousands of hosts and an ecosystem of property managers, cleaners, and other service providers are dealing with dwindling or nonexistent income.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat comes next\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAirbnb’s latest round doesn’t come with a target IPO date. The company wanted to go public this year but a global pandemic wasn’t exactly in the 5-year plan. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eReal estate experts told City Lab that some hosts might pivot to longer-term rentals to bring in money. Others think the pendulum might swing back to traditional hotels in the medium-term, where cleaning standards are a little more...consistent. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nUber the Recruiter\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Uber released a new feature that will help U.S. drivers find work both in its other divisions and at companies not at all affiliated with Uber.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe program, called the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-uber/uber-connects-out-of-work-us-ride-hail-drivers-to-delivery-production-jobs-idUSKBN21O1LV?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWork Hub\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, will connect workers to about 15 companies nationwide that are hiring in volume, including Domino's, Amazon, and Walgreens. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt'll also link drivers to internal opportunities with Uber Eats, Uber Freight, and Uber Works, the temporary staffing program it launched in 2019.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eDemand for ride-hailing has fallen off a COVID cliff. With Uber's lobbying help, the $2.2 trillion economic relief package grants \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/30/cares-act-will-be-an-economic-lifeline-for-gig-workers-freelancers.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunprecedented\u003c/a\u003e financial assistance to gig workers; however, some Uber drivers have reported difficulty \u003ca href=\"https://onezero.medium.com/drivers-say-the-uber-coronavirus-fund-is-failing-them-8c36aceace78?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egetting help\u003c/a\u003e from the company. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Work Hub shows Uber has managed to meaningfully diversify its business beyond hauling human passengers. And it syncs with the company's long-term goal of aggregating a fleet of temp workers who can move from industry to industry. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable
